data.text: This year's IMF-World Bank Annual Meetings will take place in Washington, DC, October 14-20, 2019. Follow the events here https://t.co/EDtAJaUj1d and join the conversation via #IMFmeetings https://t.co/61mYq0qOkz

Large emitting countries need to take ambitious action on taxing carbon emissions to effectively mitigate #ClimateChange by 2030. Learn more about this challenge in the #FiscalMonitor https://t.co/zm6K4DN18u https://t.co/m1j6H42VO7

Women, Work, and Leadership – watch the live one-on-one conversation with @KGeorgieva and @ForeignPolicy's Ravi Agrawal this Tuesday, October 15 at 3pm #IMFmeetings #IMFGender #GenderEquality https://t.co/Bskj0vE3E5 https://t.co/MLcDL3wNX1

One extra year of primary school boosts a woman’s earning potential by 10-20% for the rest of her life. Generation Z demands & deserves better. Join a live chat with @TashaWangMwansa @bhatiasi @ForeignPolicy on Oct. 15 at 4pm EDT https://t.co/DusgFuaOn3 #IMFinspired #IMFMeetings

Achieving the #SDGs requires a substantial spending scale-up of spending. How to tackle this challenge? Join @Lipton_IMF, @marjetajager, @UNDESA's Harris, @AMukwashi, @Citi’s Jason Channell and @RomualdWadagni on October 17 at 1pm ET https://t.co/JD1cpq4gBV #IMFmeetings #IMF2030 https://t.co/b8TXLiIjbf

Did you know that 46 countries have a carbon pricing scheme in some form, but the average tax is still very low at $2 per ton of CO2? Learn more about what governments can do more to curb #ClimateChange in our #FiscalMonitor https://t.co/xemiYJVwSf #IMFblog https://t.co/z308BBLPno
African countries with more female labor force participation have more peaceful elections. Listen to the latest @imf_podcast https://t.co/XJ7G5pWSHW #GenderEquality #IMFGender https://t.co/nddfvEbvkB

Global warming has become a clear and present threat. IMF’s Paolo Mauro talks to @katiadmi of @business about what policymakers can do to mitigate #ClimateChange. #FiscalMonitor. https://t.co/xemiYJVwSf #IMFblog #ClimateAction https://t.co/ApboD6Sfko

The window of opportunity for containing climate change is closing. Countries must act collectively and must act now. Read the IMF’s research on curbing #ClimateChange through fiscal policy. https://t.co/xemiYJVwSf #IMFblog
Non-US banks remain vulnerable to a #Dollar disruption that could transmit shocks to their home economies https://t.co/HXggTp07s0  #IMFBlog #GFSR https://t.co/d3PPcvgD0V

#ClimateChange is happening before our eyes. 18 of the warmest 19 years on record occurred after 2001. And CO2 emissions from fossil fuel combustion are leading the cause. Find out what governments can do to curb climate change in our #FiscalMonitor. https://t.co/zm6K4DN18u https://t.co/LDabQPEKBD

@TimRivera @katiadmi It's easier for a few large emitters to kick-start agreement on more ambitious action. The big players know that they have real impact on climate change, and that cutting emissions can reduce air pollution deaths at home immediately.

@Kasperzeuthen @katiadmi We've been at the forefront on carbon taxes for many years! Our report provides novel quantitative assessments at domestic & intl levels. It estimates revenues from a carbon tax & shows how to use such revenues in an economically efficient & fair way

Just released: #GFSR Chapter on Sustainable Finance: Looking Farther. Read our latest research https://t.co/SlvLQ6o1v5
 https://t.co/UYS2WGGfdx
